Line 67: Line 67:
==Personal life==
==Personal life==
â
During the filming of ''Stripes'', Murray married Margaret Kelley on [[Super Bowl]] Sunday in [[Las Vegas, Nevada|Las Vegas]] on January 25, 1981.<ref name= "chase"/><ref name= "white"/> Later, they re-married in Chicago for their families.<ref name= "chase"/> Margaret gave birth to two sons, Homer (born 1982) and Luke (born 1985). In August 2009, Luke became a graduate assistant with the basketball team at the [[University of Arizona]],<ref>[http://wildcat.arizona.edu/sports/actor-s-son-joins-basketball-staff-1.303855 ''Arizona Daily Wildcat''] - "Actor's son joins basketball staff"</ref> which is one of the top programs in college basketball. Following Murray's affair with [[Jennifer Butler]], the couple divorced in 1996. In 1997, he married Jennifer Butler. Together, they have four sons: Caleb (born January 11, 1993), Jackson (born October 6, 1995), Cooper (born January 27, 1997), and Lincoln (born May 30, 2001). Butler filed for divorce on May 12, 2008, accusing Murray of [[domestic violence]].<ref>http://www.charleston.net/news/2008/may/29/bill_murray_sued_divorce42566/</ref> Their divorce was finalized on June 13, 2008.
+
During the filming of ''Stripes'', Murray married Margaret Kelley on [[Super Bowl]] Sunday in [[Las Vegas, Nevada|Las Vegas]] on January 25, 1981.<ref name= "chase"/><ref name= "white"/> Later, they re-married in Chicago for their families.<ref name= "chase"/> Margaret gave birth to two sons, Homer (born 1982) and Luke (born 1985). In August 2009, Luke became a graduate assistant with the basketball team at the [[University of Arizona]],<ref>[http://wildcat.arizona.edu/sports/actor-s-son-joins-basketball-staff-1.303855 ''Arizona Daily Wildcat''] - "Actor's son joins basketball staff"</ref>. Following Murray's affair with [[Jennifer Butler]], the couple divorced in 1996. In 1997, he married Jennifer Butler. Together, they have four sons: Caleb (born January 11, 1993), Jackson (born October 6, 1995), Cooper (born January 27, 1997), and Lincoln (born May 30, 2001). Butler filed for divorce on May 12, 2008, accusing Murray of [[domestic violence]].<ref>http://www.charleston.net/news/2008/may/29/bill_murray_sued_divorce42566/</ref> Their divorce was finalized on June 13, 2008.
Murray has homes in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]], [[Martha's Vineyard, Massachusetts]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mvmagazine.com/2006/july/hot_tin_roof.php|title=Under (one) Hot Tin Roof|publisher =Martha's Vineyard Magazine|accessdate=2008-01-11}}</ref> [[Charleston, South Carolina]], and [[Rockland County, New York]], just outside of New York City.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mondostars.com/entertainment/billmurray.html|title=Bill Murray: Funny, crazy and sweet|publisher =MondoStars|accessdate=2008-01-11}}</ref>
Murray has homes in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]], [[Martha's Vineyard, Massachusetts]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mvmagazine.com/2006/july/hot_tin_roof.php|title=Under (one) Hot Tin Roof|publisher =Martha's Vineyard Magazine|accessdate=2008-01-11}}</ref> [[Charleston, South Carolina]], and [[Rockland County, New York]], just outside of New York City.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mondostars.com/entertainment/billmurray.html|title=Bill Murray: Funny, crazy and sweet|publisher =MondoStars|accessdate=2008-01-11}}</ref>
